thread.title: Fans race to get 'Back to the Future' paper
thread.title_full: Fans race to get 'Back to the Future' paper

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Fans race to get 'Back to the Future' paper
text:
What's the best way to celebrate the future? With a print newspaper, of course ‚Äî specifically, with the same Oct. 22, 2015, edition of USA TODAY that Marty McFly picked up in the 1989 film Back to the Future Part II. Fans flocked to newsstands to grab a copy of Thursday's nostalgia-laden USA TODAY, which is wrapped in a prop replica of the paper featured in the time-travel movie starring Michael J. Fox.
From the Cubs sweeping the World Series (so close, yet so far), to a study on cholesterol curing cancer (hello, Paleo ... kind of) to a review of Jaws 19 (is Sharknado really that different?!), fans reveled in this alternate ‚Äî but shockingly believable ‚Äî reality of 2015.
The USA TODAY- Back to the Future mashup was noted by the Today show , Entertainment Weekly , Mashable and Quartz , among other media outlets. USA TODAY remained a trending topic on Facebook and Twitter throughout the day. To put it lightly, people were stoked.
Great Scott! Guess you could say #usatoday #bttf edition was a success.
A video posted by Lindsay Deutsch (@baffledlindsay) on Oct 22, 2015 at 2:51pm PDT
This is so #cool!!!! Don't remember the last time a #newspaper did something like this right?? Now I want to watch the #movies all over again!!! üéõüì∞üèÉüèªüé• #BTTF #usatoday @usatoday #bttf2015
A photo posted by Dorinda Medley (@dorindamedley) on Oct 22, 2015 at 8:25am PDT
Extra, extra, read all about it! Marty McFly arrested! #onnewsstandstoday #usatoday #hillvalleyedition #backtothefuture @el_donaldo
A photo posted by Lisa Sorenson (@lisa_sorenson) on Oct 22, 2015 at 1:49pm PDT
Gave my family a mission to find me one of these newspapers. They all succeeded #backtothefuture #docbrown #bttf #usatoday #pop #martymcfly #trilogy #delorean #fluxcapacitor #30thanniversary
A photo posted by Maria (@bbycakes8) on Oct 22, 2015 at 2:33pm PDT
Those who couldn't snag their own copy of the paper Thursday headed to USA TODAY's online store . Readers also flocked to eBay to secure their copies, where throughout Thursday bidders were lucky to get a copy for $20 , ten times the paper's usual price.
Once newspapers sold out, fans flocked to Ebay for a copy of the special USA TODAY. (Photo: Screenshot/Ebay)
Didn't get yourself a copy? Don't fret ‚Äî there's lots of good content online. To start, check out what Back to the Future writer Bob Gale predicts for the next 30 years . After all, he wasn't that far off the first time!
And don't forget this wondrous promo video, featuring Doc Brown at his finest.
